text: Cheligium lineatum is a moth in the family Lasiocampidae. It was described by Per Olof Christopher Aurivillius in 1893. It is found in Angola, Cameroon, Gabon, Nigeria and Sierra Leone. The wingspan is about 110 mm. Both wings are palish brown, the forewings with a curved, longitudinal paler stripe from the base below the cell to the costa almost into the apex. The hindwings are uniform and slightly darker than the forewings. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1893 Category:Lasiocampidae Category:Moths of Africa Category:Taxa named by Per Olof Christopher Aurivillius
title: Cheligium lineatum
